alert.note: Alert for Eastern Alaska Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 11 at 12:45PM AKST until February 13 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM SUNDAY TO 3 PM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow expected. North winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Visibility will be reduced to one half mile or less at times in blowing snow. Significant drifts of snow are likely. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range, mainly Isabel Pass. * WHEN...From 3 PM Sunday to 3 PM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...North winds will gust to 40 mph from Trims Camp southward. With 3 to 5 inches of new snowfall today through tonight, significant drifting of snowfall is also likely.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
